body:
> I wonder if similar issues exist in mysql or other databases...

Good question. This might be the case since [`translate_exception` in the mysql adapters](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activerecord/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/abstract_mysql_adapter.rb#L659) call `super` and the `super` implementation is [to raise a `StatementInvalid`](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activerecord/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/abstract_adapter.rb#L436) exception.

Seems worth to investigate. To do this I recommend create a test to the MySQL adapters and see if the original exception is raised. WDYT? Want to investigate?

BTW, thank you so much for your pull request.
